metaImage.description: DO NOT REMOVE, THIS IS CLOUDFLARE'S GLOBAL OG META ASSET

relatedBlades.entityTitle: Reference Architecture Center - half width hero

leftHalf.title: Cloudflare Architecture Center
leftHalf.copy: Design Cloudflare into your environment easily with reference architectures, diagrams and technical guides. Learn how Cloudflare works and how it integrates with your existing infrastructure.

features.title: Content Delivery Network
features.description: Learn how to improve latency, performance, and security using our global Anycast network, Tiered Cache, and Argo Smart Routing.

features.title: Security Architecture
features.description: Learn how Cloudflare has built and operates a vast global security network and what services on this platform can be used by you to protect your public and private resources.

features.title: SASE
features.description: Learn how to leverage Cloudflare's SASE platform as part of your Zero Trust initiatives.

relatedBlades.title: Browse all content
relatedBlades.description: The Cloudflare Architecture Center provides vetted technical documentation that contains architectural diagrams, best practices and integration guidelines across the entire Cloudflare platform. Reference architectures and their diagrams describe high level integration landscapes. Design guides walk you through the decision making process for a given solution, and implementation guides give you the hands on instructions to complete your integration with Cloudflare.

resourceList.title: [Architecture Center] - Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
resourceList.resourceTitle: Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resourceList.description: Cloudflare's secure access service edge (SASE) platform protects applications, users, devices, and networks. By adopting Cloudflare, organizations move away from a patchwork of hardware appliances and other point solutions to consolidate security and networking capabilities on one unified control plane.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Cloudflare Security Architecture
resources.description: Learn how Cloudflare has built and operates a vast global security network and what services on this platform can be used by you to protect your public and private resources.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Architecture using Cloudflare SASE with Microsoft
resources.resourceTitle: Architecture using Cloudflare SASE with Microsoft
resources.description: Learn about the many ways Cloudflare's Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) integrates with Microsoft's cloud services to bolster security and performance in hybrid environments.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Load Balancing - Reference Architecture
resources.description: Cloudflare Load Balancing is a global and local traffic management solution that allows organizations to host applications for a global user base while vastly reducing concerns of maintenance, failover, resiliency, and scalability while fully integrating with Cloudflare's other services.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Magic Transit - Reference Architecture
resources.description: Learn about the key architecture, functionalities, and network deployment options of Cloudflare Magic Transit â€” a BGP-based DDoS protection and traffic acceleration service for Internet-facing network infrastructure.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
resources.resourceTitle: Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Cloudflare's secure access service edge (SASE) platform protects applications, users, devices, and networks. By adopting Cloudflare, organizations move away from a patchwork of hardware appliances and other point solutions to consolidate security and networking capabilities on one unified control plane.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Content Delivery Network - Reference Architecture
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Cloudflare CDN helps address the challenges customers face around latency, performance, availability, redundancy, security, and costs. The Cloudflare CDN leverages Cloudflare's global Anycast network, Tiered Cache, and Argo Smart Routing to deliver optimized results while saving costs for customers.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Multi-vendor - Reference Architecture
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Understand why some customers deploy a multiple or dual vendor approach and how Cloudflare can be incorporated into such a solution. Specifically, this document describes how a multi-vendor approach for application security and performance can be accomplished and is targeted for architects.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Optimizing Image Delivery with Cloudflare Image Resizing and R2
resources.resourceTitle: Optimizing Image Delivery with Cloudflare Image Resizing and R2
resources.description: Images can slow down web page rendering and degrade user experience. Learn how Cloudflare's platform optimizes image delivery and stores images at the edge, improving performance and user satisfaction.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - A/B-testing using Workers
resources.description: A/B testing is a method of comparing two versions of a webpage or app to determine which performs better given a metric to optimize for. This document describes how Cloudflare's platform can be used to implement server-side A/B testing.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Fullstack web applications
resources.description: Cloudflare offers all building blocks to build, deploy and operate fullstack applications. This document describes how Cloudflare's platform can be used for modern, secure and performant fullstack applications.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Multi-vendor AI observability and control
resources.description: Forward proxies positioned between services making inference requests and inference providers, can serve as a single point for observability and control. Discover how AI Gateway can be integrated into a multi-vendor architecture.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Securing data in transit
resources.description: Secure all communications to and from your applications. Detect confidential data as it travels over the Cloudflare network and implement access control policies to enforce authorized access.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Securing data in use
resources.description: Detect and protect data in use by leveraging our cloud host remote browser isolation. Limit what users can do with confidential data in their browser.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Serverless global APIs
resources.description: APIs account for a significant share of internet traffic. Building scalable, performant APIs can be challenging and costly. This document describes how serverless APIs can be globally deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Composable AI architecture
resources.description: Composability, data portability, and standardized APIs are crucial factors in navigating the complexities of the quickly-changing AI ecosystem. This document describes how Cloudflare's AI platform is fully composable and interoperable with other solutions.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Securing data at rest
resources.description: Continuously analyze SaaS applications & data-at-rest to detect misconfigurations, exposed files, and suspicious activities

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Egress-free object storage in multi-cloud setups
resources.resourceTitle: Egress-free object storage in multi-cloud setups
resources.description: Multi-cloud setups promise resilience, flexibility, and mitigating risks of vendor lock-in. However, egress fees can make such setups cost prohibitive. This document describes how Cloudflare's zero-egress object storage can enable cost-effective multi-cloud setups.

resources.title: Serverless ETL pipelines
resources.description: ETL pipelines are data processing workflows that extract, transform, and load raw data from diverse sources into structured formats for analysis, reporting, and other downstream applications. This document describes how serverless ETL pipelines can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Access to private apps without having to deploy client agents
resources.resourceTitle: Access to private apps without having to deploy client agents
resources.description: Discover the seamless pathway to accessing your private web applications effortlessly without having to deploy client agents.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Serverless image content management
resources.description: Use Cloudflare to create a scalable image management solution to upload images, manage access, and deliver optimized versions based on user device and network conditions. Integrate with Cloudflare AI for image classification, Cloudflare R2 for storage while metadata is kept in our key/value store.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
resources.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is an innovative approach in natural language processing that integrates retrieval mechanisms with generative models to enhance text generation. This document describes how an RAG solution can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Automatic captioning for video uploads
resources.description: Automatic captioning and translations make video content more accessible and broadens audiences. This document describes how an AI-powered automatic captioning for videos solution can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Content-based asset creation
resources.description: Composing multiple AI models together can abstract complexity and allow for powerful end-user use cases. This document describes how a simple application that creates contextual visual assets based on text input can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Building zero trust architecture into your startup
resources.resourceTitle: Building zero trust architecture into your startup
topic: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce
resources.description: Explore common considerations, recommendations, and best practices for building Zero Trust concepts into the fabric of your startup business.

resources.title: [Design Guide] - Securely deliver applications with Cloudflare
resources.description: Learn how easy it is to use Cloudflare's collective services regardless of where workloads run. For the example in this document, an application workload will use Cloudflare DNS, CDN, WAF, and Access while also using Cloudflare Tunnel to connect securely to the Cloudflare network.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Secure your Internet traffic and SaaS apps
resources.resourceTitle: Secure your Internet traffic and SaaS apps
resources.description: Provide your users and networks with a secure, performant, and flexible path to the Internet.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Replace your VPN
topic: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce
resources.description: Learn how to use Cloudflare for secure and auditable access to your networks and applications.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Deploy zero trust web access
topic: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce
resources.description: Secure access to internal web applications without a device client.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Cloudflare Security Architecture
resources.description: Learn how Cloudflare has built and operates a vast global security network and what services on this platform can be used by you to protect your public and private resources.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
resources.resourceTitle: Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Cloudflare's secure access service edge (SASE) platform protects applications, users, devices, and networks. By adopting Cloudflare, organizations move away from a patchwork of hardware appliances and other point solutions to consolidate security and networking capabilities on one unified control plane.
